page.title: 08Hawkridge Reservior Spaxton.
page.content: Hawkridge Reservior situated in the foothills of the Quantocks is under the control of the Wessex Water Authority. Its primary function is to supply water via Ashford Water Treatment Works to the consumers of Bridgwater and surrounding district. Construction of the reservoir was completed in 1964 and it covers a flooded area of 35 acres. The19.8metre high mass gravity concrete Dam impounds a maximum of 190 million gallons of water which is collected from gathering grounds of 2,690 acres and fed to the reservoir via the Merridge and Aisholt streams. The reservoir also attracts large numbers of sightseers during the summer period especially at weekends. A sailing club with about 60 members uses the reservoir. They also have 10 sailing board members.
